intro: Vincetoxicum multinerve, commonly known as the narrow-leafed false bindweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Loganiaceae family. It is characterized by its compound leaves with a distinct vein pattern and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. The plant is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It has a creeping growth habit with hairy stems and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its invasive tendencies in some regions, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural and natural settings.
